primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preservation of the covenantal identity (mantra) through the generations of Israel, contrasted with the failure of Joseph to maintain that identity within the imperial system.

subject.identificatie: Joseph (as the representative of the 'umpteenth generation' hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: Joseph proceeds to do more than interpret. He advises.
Joseph achieves for Pharaoh... a monopoly of food
Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh.

object.identificatie: Covenantal Identity / Inclusion in the 'Theological Mantra'
tekstueel_bewijs: The people who hold to the vision and to the promise with courage and steadiness remain in the theological mantra.

zender.identificatie: The Memory of Israel / The Tradition
tekstueel_bewijs: Israel’s long and wise memory knows, and so drops him from the theological mantra.
I may not be talking about him at all, but about someone closer to our own time and place.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify with the Subject (Joseph) to avoid his failure.

tekstueel_bewijs: I have introduced Paul before Agrippa... as a counterpoint to Joseph.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the source of the initial 'investment' but is largely absent as an active Subject in the present crisis.

tegenstander.identificatie: Pharaoh / The Imperial Nightmare of Scarcity
tekstueel_bewijs: Pharaoh, the cipher in the Old Testament for all that is a threat to Israel’s faith.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is a systemic, economic, and political 'nightmare' that seduces rather than destroys.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's providential care for the ancestors (Abraham, Isaac, Jacob).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Joseph's choice) is a response to the secondary program (God's past action). The sermon focuses on the failure of the response.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Israel's Memory → Inclusion in Mantra → The Hearer

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has taken away my reproach
everything that God could give him
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Joseph proceeds to do more than interpret.
He might have countered Pharaoh’s nightmare.
He has distanced himself from old covenantal dreams.

voorbeelden: The people who hold to the vision... remain in the theological mantra.
Joseph was... evidently excessively eager, too accustomed to success.
There is always a choice between an evangelical vision and an imperial nightmare.
Joseph has intelligence not available in the empire.
Israel’s long and wise memory knows.
He might have countered Pharaoh’s nightmare.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on the Subject's desire and choice (Vouloir) between two competing visions (Promise vs. Nightmare).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: S1 (Ancestors) → ~S1 (Joseph's sellout) → S2 (Pharaoh's system) → ~S2 (Paul's resistance) → Call to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through human 'steadiness' and 'courage' to choose the right vision.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Scarcity is presented as a powerful, seductive psychological and economic reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses biblical narrative, the engine is anthropocentric. The 'Mantra' (salvation/memory) is conditional upon the Subject's (Joseph/Hearer) performance and 'steadiness'. God is the 'Sender' of the initial gift but not the 'Subject' of the current deliverance.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The people who hold to the vision... remain in the theological mantra.
He might have countered Pharaoh’s nightmare with Israel’s promise.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: everything that God could give him, through his family and in spite of his family.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Joseph is a negative example (the sellout) and Paul is a positive example (the one who didn't yield).
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: A theocentric reading would focus on God as the one who remains 'the God of Joseph' despite Joseph's sellout, or God as the one who delivers Israel from the very system Joseph helped build.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety regarding their own 'generation' and whether they are currently 'selling out'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation (being in the mantra) is a matter of ethical/political alignment.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a call to socio-political faithfulness, but theologically disconnected from a 'Soteriology of Grace'.
spanning_punten: The 'God of the promise' is mentioned, but this God does not act to reclaim the 'sellout'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The choice between evangelical vision and imperial nightmare.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The hearer is expected to have the 'Pouvoir' (power) to choose based on 'Savoir' (knowledge of the story).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'seduced' compliance with a bad system.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a prophetic critique where the Hearer is the Subject and 'Faithfulness' is the Object. God is a passive background figure.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Joseph/Hearer is the only one who can fix the 'sellout'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject who pursues the 'dropout'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Joseph dropped out,' use 'God refuses to let the fourth generation go, even when they sell out to the empire.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'hero' who must choose correctly.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer as the one enslaved by the empire whom God (not Joseph) must liberate.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Heavenly Vision' actually empowers the weak, rather than just demanding obedience.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'Empire' is already a strong opponent.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is strong enough; the issue is the weakness of the Subject (God).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish that God is 'the God of Joseph' (Soteriology) before demanding Joseph act like it (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and prophetically sharp, but structurally it places the burden of the Covenant entirely on human shoulders.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'nightmare/vision' metaphor; Greimas reveals this metaphor is powered by human effort.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical Joseph; Greimas shows how the preacher uses Joseph as a functional 'Subject-proxy' for the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'The God of Abraham' is a Sender who stops sending when the Receiver fails, making the 'Grace' of the promise conditional.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon relies on a 'Subject-Switch' from God to the Hearer at the moment of crisis.
